result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyran L Culpepper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and any other  sentences.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment or community service.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Tina A. without prior Court approval.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continued programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Particpate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2 and any other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 107 days time served.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS AND 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1 and any other sentences), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 3 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
--- as to count #2.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Tina A. without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment or community service.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
  Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
  -- pay the costs and fees for count #1.
* Restitution is set at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
 
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in custody.  Dax Odom for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing Hearing.

BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 04

AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor
AS TO COUNT 2
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 973.055(1), 939.621(1)(b)&(2), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Br. 4 involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter transferred to Br. 23 for a plea.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Kyran L Culpepper not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-14-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Kyran L Culpepper not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Upon the request of defense counsel, who just obtained a new offer from the State, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-31-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing JANUARY 28, 2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  James moczydlowski  1333 College Avenue  Ste K  South Milwaukee, WI  53172  PD Appointed.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Kyran L Culpepper not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FILE NOT IN COURT.
Court waived the appearanceof defendant, upon the request of defense counsel.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in custody.  Katie Seelow, student intern under the supervision of Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF387 and case #06CM759 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Dustin Frank-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to Branch 4 in trial, case transferred to Prelim Court for Preliminary Hearing.   mld
Due to ADA assignment case is re-assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: TINA A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Kyran L Culpepper in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
